thread.title: Beijing awarded the 2022 Winter Olympic Games | The
thread.title_full: Beijing awarded the 2022 Winter Olympic Games | The Advertiser

title: Beijing awarded the 2022 Winter Olympic Games | The
text:
THE IOC has selected Beijing as its host city for the 2022 Winter Olympic Games, making the Chinese capital the first city to host both Summer and Winter Games.
Beijing and Almaty, Kazakhstan, were the only two candidates in the voting by the International Olympic Committee.
The vote was delayed by technical problems involving the electronic voting system, so the members voted again by paper ballot with the results just announced.
President of the International Olympic Committee (IOC) Thomas Bach opens the envelope announcing that Beijing has won the bid to host the 2022 Winter Olympic Games. Source: AP
After the second vote, IOC President Thomas Bach said a host city had been elected. He said he would announce the winner at a ceremony later.
Almaty hoped to take the games to Central Asia for the first time but the IOC ultimately went with Beijing, which held the Summer Olympics in 2008, for the 2022 event.
The IOCâ€™s announcement in Kuala Lumpur attracted little protest, a significant change from a candidate city briefing were pro-Tibet protesters broke intot the hotel and unfurled banners.
Originally published as Beijing awarded 2022 Winter Olympics
